Uh, people, I hate to tell you this, but the story about Americans abusing the Koran in order to enrage prisoners has been out there for quite some time. The first mention I found of it is March 17, 2004, when the Independent of London interviewed the first British citizen released from Guantanamo Bay. The prisoner said he had been physically beaten but did not consider that as bad as the psychological torture, which he described extensively. Jamal al-Harith, a computer programmer from Manchester, said 70 percent of the inmates had gone on a hunger strike after a guard kicked a copy of the Koran. The strike was ended by force-feeding. 
 
 Then came the report, widely covered in American media last December, by the International Red Cross concerning torture at Gitmo. I wrote at the time: "In the name of Jesus Christ Almighty, why are people representing our government, paid by us, writing filth on the Korans of helpless prisoners? Is this American? Is this Christian? What are our moral values? Where are the clergymen on this? Speak up, speak out." 
 
 The reports kept coming: Dec. 30, 2004, "Released Moroccan Guantanamo Detainee Tells Islamist Paper of His Ordeal," reported the Financial Times. "They watched you each time you went to the toilet; the American soldiers used to tear up copies of Koran and throw them in the toilet. ..." said the released prisoner. 
 
 ....
 
 So where does all this leave us? With a story that is not only true, but previously reported numerous times. So let's drop the "Lynch Newsweek" bull. Seventeen people have died in these riots. They didn't die because of anything Newsweek did -- the riots were caused by what our government has done. 
 
 http://www.commondreams.org/views05/0517-34.htm

Atrocities [apparently] committed -< Newsweek reports -< people hate Newsweek
 
 Saddam commits atrocities - < numerous reports -< people hate Saddam
 
 wtf?
 
 Even if it did result in lives being lost, tough. Before "liberating" another country, you need to have free media in your own country. If you were really that concerned with not angering terrorists, then not invading Iraq would probably have been a nice idea.
 
 -Wez

 The thing is, nothing that was done was illegal or in violation of any international law. It is a matter of conditioning prisoners and breaking them of their will so that they can be "declawed" so to speak. It is very similar (allbeit, more severe) to the way boot camp strips a recruit of his individuality so that he can be taught to function as a team player. There is nothing in the Geneva convention or any international law that says we even have to provide them with Korans in the first place. These terrorists need to be deprived of their pride and their will. Being that the biggest factor that is driving them is their warped version of the Islam religion, it only makes sense that our interrogators and captors use that as a weapon against them. When you are fighting an enemy that is driven by mass psychosis, your most valuable weapon is psychology. We are not interested in merely imprisoning terrorists the way we do with our common criminals. These people will not be rehabilitated by "doing time." They will always be threat.
 
 Sure, there have been reports out already that point to the fact that this is happening, but when an outlet like Newsweek picks it up, it is like a huge megaphone broadcasting it load and clear all over the world. I don't remember any of those other reports resulting in mass riots and murder in several countries simulataneously across the globe, do you? So, it WAS the impact of the story that fanned the flame, not the act itself.
 
 Desecration of the Koran is punishable by death in most Muslim countries. But we don't play according to those rules, nor do we have to. The only ones who would be seriously impacted by the Newsweek article are the Muslims of the world. So what Newsweek is basically doing is picking up a huge megaphone, and blasting out loud and clear to the Muslim world; "HEY, ALL YOU MUSLIMS! GUESS WHAT AMERICA IS DOING TO YOUR PRECIOUS KORAN???!! AMERICA IS SPITTING IN THE FACE OF YOUR RELIGION!". But anyone with any common sense knows that this is not about America's disrespect for Islam. It is about dealing with captured terrorists. If a KKK member who terrorizes blacks decides that he is a Christian fundamentalist and that the bible defines his reason for being, I am sure that we would not hesitate to flush his bible down the crapper as well, especially if it would help reduce him to a level where he could be more easily interrogated in order to stop further violence.
 
 What really makes me mad though, is that Newsweek had to stoop to the level of Dan Rather and Jason Blair in order to achieve their goal of pointing the finger of blame at the U.S. military. I repeat; EVEN IF STUFF LIKE THIS IS HAPPENING, THERE IS NOTHING ILLEGAL, IMMORAL OR FATTENING ABOUT IT. And our own press does not need to be a mouth piece for the enemy.
